ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This semester, I learned about various Latin American historical events, influential people, and disparate writing styles. I reflected much on how these people were able to create the impacts they did and how the historical context in which they lived shaped their thoughts and actions.
knowledge of the relationship between colonialism and latin american literature, improved analysis skills in spanish, improved writing skills in spanish
I learned many reading skills. How to decipher the greater meaning and applications of different texts.
I learned about colonial Latin America from both the perspectives of the colonizers and the indigenous people. The class also helped me to improve my speaking skills.
I learned about the history of Spanish colonization through primary source documents, as well as honed my ability to speak and think critically about the topic using Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The syllabus became repetitive at times, and some readings were very pretty long and complicated, which were hard to comprehend. Other than that, the course was well done.
The readings were pretty difficult as expected and I wouldve liked to spend some more time really dissecting some texts

Strength: Professor Broner did an excellent job engaging the whole class. The homework level was enough to help us learnt the material and the language without being overwhelming.

Weakness: It may have helped to build a vocabulary list as a class for each module.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone looking to become fluent in Spanish or expand their knowledge of Latin American history and literature.
Yes, the course was very informational with a very kind professor who made it interesting and engaging
Yes I would definitely recommend it, especially if Professor Broner is teaching.
Yes!! My Spanish improved and I got to engage with primary sources. Also, Professor Broner was great!

extras.title: LAST 266 01/SPAN 266 01 - Studies In Latin American Lit
